Strategic Focuses: NVIDIA reported revenue for the fourth quarter of fiscal 2025 of $39.3 billion | In Q4, Data Center revenue reached $35.6 billion, a record, up 16% sequentially and 93% year on year | Inference demand is accelerating, driven by new reasoning models such as OpenAI’s o3 and DeepSeek-R1 .

NVIDIA reported revenue for the third quarter of fiscal 2025 of $35.1 billion | Data Center revenue was $30.8 billion, up 17% sequentially and 112% year over year | Data center revenue grew strongly in North America, India, and Asia Pacific | Blackwell architecture enables up to 30x faster inference and better scaling for reasoning AI .

NVIDIA reported revenue for the second quarter of fiscal 2025 of $28.0 billion | Data Center revenue was up 21% sequentially and 141% year over year | Automotive revenue reached $350 million, up 20% year on year | Gaming revenue was $2.5 billion, up 5% .

NVIDIA today reported revenue for the first quarter ended April 27, 2025, of $44.1 billion, up 12 % from the previous quarter and up 69 % from a year ago | Data Center revenue was $39.1billion, up 10 % from Q4 and up 73 % from year ago...
